title: update all packages to use actix-web v3
body:
## PR Type
Dependencies


## PR Checklist
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added / updated.
- [x] Documentation comments have been added / updated.
- [x] A changelog entry has been made for the appropriate packages.
- [x] Format code with the latest stable rustfmt


## Overview
Prepare for v3 release.

title: actix-cors: cosmetic fixes

This rewords part of the docstrings for better readability,
and introduces additional lints. That includes ensuring that
all public types implement the Debug trait.

title: exclude default -web features where not needed

body: Fixes #10

title: Minimize `futures` dependency
body: I believe this would be the last round.

title: httpauth: Remove badge metadata
body: crates.io no longer displays this badge on the crate pages.

title: Bugfix: AuthenticationError should set status_code
body: I noticed that my `AuthenticationError`'s `status_code` field was 401, but when I ran `.as_response_error()` the `ResponseError`'s code was 500 (the default value). It's because impl ResponseError for AuthenticationError doesn't define the `status_code()` trait method. Merely setting the status code in `error_response` isn't enough, it seems. I added a unit test for this case too. The test will fail without my change, and pass with it.

title: redis: Bump up to 0.8.2
body: CC #54 and @robjtede

title: Documentation update: RedisSessionBackend is renamed to RedisSession
body: Small documentation update :) From the commit history I can see that the RedisSessionBackend is renamed to RedisSession.

title: Compile the actix-protobuf example during CI test runs
body: Followup of #44. Fixes #43

title: Clarify how to use Session::set_session()
body:
It currently is not clear how to use `Session::set_session()`. There is no documentation, and all tests use the same example data which use a strange, double-quoted string, but it is not clarified that this is intended to be data which is serialized into JSON. 

```
Session::set_session(
    vec![("key".to_string(), "\"value\"".to_string())].into_iter(),
    &mut req,
);
```

For users it might not be clear how to handle data types other than strings.

Let's add some variety in the examples with different data types, make it explicit in the examples that we are expecting to see data serialized by `serde_json::to_string()`, and add some documentation to the function.

title: Allow for session cookies to be lazily created
body:
When laziness is enabled for the CookieSession, the cookie only gets added once the session has some data. But the current default behavior would remain unaffected unless lazy sessions are toggled on.

Behavior like this is quite useful when trying to make things compatible with cookie laws, where you might not want to store cookies until you've gained the visitor's permission to do so.

I'm really hoping for some feedback, and I'm guessing that there are better ways of doing this :)
